Class GameSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameSession
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, PokerConstant

    public class GameSession
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, PokerConstant
    This class is a used in serverSide to handle the Game session of a Poker Game.
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    Rabi Thapa

           java.net.Socket player2,
           java.io.ObjectOutputStream toClient,
           java.io.ObjectOutputStream toClient2,
           javax.swing.JTextArea serverLog)
        GameSession Constructor which sets Client sockets and their object streams.
        Parameters:
        player1 - first socket
        player2 - second socket
        toClient - ObjectOutputStream
        toClient2 - ObjectInputStream
        serverLog - server side log JTextArea for game session

        currentRound - current game round
        playerAction - current player's action
        currentBidToMatch - current bid to match

      • sendChipsUpdate

        private void sendChipsUpdate(java.io.ObjectOutputStream toPlayer,
                   double currPot,
                   double p1TotalBid,
                   double p2TotalBid,
                   double p1Total,
                   double p2Total)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        This method sends chips update via ObjectOutputStream.
        Parameters:
        toPlayer - object output stream
        currPot - current chips in pot
        p1TotalBid - Player 1 total bids this game
        p2TotalBid - Player 2 total bids this game
        p1Total - Player 1 total left chips
        p2Total - Player 2 total left chips
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • updateCurrentBidToMatch

        public void updateCurrentBidToMatch()
        This method updates current bid that needs to matched by other player

      • findTheWinner

        public void findTheWinner()
        This method Calculates the both player hands and sets the winning player to winnerIs variable. This method also checks weather both players have same hand value e.g a pair is common in 7 hand poker and both player could have a pair. In this situation it compares the high card within the pair of both players.

      • findHighCard

        public void findHighCard(Card[] h,
                int pHighCard)

      • checkHandValueTotal

        public void checkHandValueTotal(Card[] pHand,
                       Card[] pFullHand,
                       int playerNumber)
        This method checks a players hand value and stores it to a variable in int. At first it copies a player hand and flop hand cards array to a 7 hand cards array. Then it calculates the hand value using valueHand() method and stores the value in respected variables.
        Parameters:
        pHand - players hand which will consist of 2 cards
        pFullHand - players full hand which will consist of 7 card (2 players card + 5 flop cards)
        playerNumber - this is to know if its player 1 or player 2 hand value
